title: Vote to preserve due process
text:
ANALYSIS/OPINION:

As the primaries approach, there are a couple of critical issues voters should keep foremost in their minds (“Trump urges Brett Kavanaugh libel lawsuits after new allegations surface,” Web, Sept. 15).

If you vote for a Democrat — any Democrat — you are voting to give up your due-process rights. Second, if you vote for a Democrat — any Democrat — you are voting to give up your right to the presumption of innocence.

Above all, voters must understand that few Democrats have the capacity to distinguish between an accusation and a conviction. For Democrats, accusations are convictions. For Democrats, there are no such things as false accusations.

They really are out to get you.

GORDON E. FINLEY

Professor of psychology emeritus

Florida International University

Miami
